data.name: Bangsamoro Commission for the Preservation of Cultural Heritage
data.description: Attached to Office of the Chief Minister. Leads the preservation of Bangsamoro cultural heritage, coordinates with national cultural agencies, and establishes institutions, programs, and projects to protect historical and cultural assets.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Research on Bangsamoro History:
The amount of Nine Million Pesos (P9,000,000.00) appropriated shall be used for the research and writing of Bangsamoro history.

Recognition of Historical Sites, Landmarks, and Structures:
The amount of One Million Pesos (P1,000,000.00) appropriated shall be used exclusively for the installation of markers for validated historical sites, landmarks, and shrines.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
The implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on its financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
(a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
(b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
(c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when said reports have been submitted or posted on its website to the MFBM and other offices where the submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Leads the preservation of Bangsamoro cultural heritage, coordinates with national cultural agencies, and establishes institutions, programs, and projects to protect historical and cultural assets.

data.name: Bangsamoro Sports Commission
data.description: Attached to Office of the Chief Minister. Formulates policy and implements programs for sports development, using sports as a tool for peace, transitional justice, and community building.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Financial Incentive for Athletes:
The amount of Five Million Pesos (P5,000,000.00) appropriated shall be used exclusively for the Financial Incentive for Athletes, subject to the submission of Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
The implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on its financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
(a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
(b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
(c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when said reports have been submitted or posted on its website to the MFBM and other offices where the submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Formulates policy and implements programs for sports development, using sports as a tool for peace, transitional justice, and community building.

data.name: Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Agrarian Reform
data.description: Promotes sustainable agri-fishery growth, equitable land distribution, and tenurial security, ensuring food security through climate-resilient support services and agri-aqua enterprise development.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Basic Integration for Harmonized Intervention (BINHI):
The amount of Three Hundred Seventy-Six Million Seven Hundred Eighty-Eight Thousand Six Hundred Ninety-Nine Pesos (P376,788,699.00) appropriated, subject to the submission of Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and quarterly status report of implementation to MFBM, shall be used as follows:
2.1 Productivity Enhancement Project for Small Landholder Farmers in the Bangsamoro Region. The amount of Three Hundred Twenty-Four Million Nine Hundred Twenty-Four Thousand One Hundred Ninety-Nine Pesos (P324,924,199.00) shall be used exclusively for the distribution of agricultural inputs support to production and community-based rice production, subject further to the submission of list of validated beneficiaries.
2.2 Input Provision of Livestock and Poultry. The amount of Twenty Million Six Hundred Fourteen Thousand Five Hundred Pesos (P20,614,500.00) shall be used exclusively for the distribution of livestock and poultry, subject further to the submission of list of validated beneficiaries.
2.3 Support to Agricultural Machineries, Equipment, Facilities and Infrastructure. The amount of Thirty-One Million Two Hundred Fifty Thousand Pesos (P31,250,000.00) shall be used exclusively for support to agricultural machineries, equipment, facilities and infrastructure, subject further to the submission of list of validated beneficiaries.

Integrated and Sustainable Development for Aquaculture/Capture (ISDA):
The amount of One Hundred Thirty-Four Million Three Hundred Forty-One Thousand Four Hundred Fifteen Pesos (P134,341,415.00) appropriated, subject to the submission of Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and quarterly status report of implementation to MFBM, shall be used as follows:
5.1 Fisheries Production Support Project. The amount of Sixty-Three Million Nine Hundred Thirty-Five Thousand Nine Hundred Twenty-Four Pesos (P63,935,924.00) shall be used exclusively for the implementation of the Fisheries Production Support Project, subject further to the submission of list of validated beneficiaries.
5.2 Fisheries Post-Harvest and Marketing Support Project. The amount of Sixty Million Thirty-Seven Thousand Two Hundred Forty-One Pesos (P60,037,241.00) shall be used exclusively for the implementation of the Fisheries Post-Harvest and Marketing Support Project, subject further to the submission of list of validated beneficiaries.
5.3 Fisheries Resource Management Project. The amount of Ten Million Three Hundred Sixty-Eight Thousand Two Hundred Fifty Pesos (P10,368,250.00) shall be used exclusively for the implementation of the Fisheries Resource Management Project, subject further to the submission of list of validated beneficiaries.

Sustainable Development for Agrarian Reform Beneficiaries in the Bangsamoro (SDAReBB):
The total amount of Thirty Million Two Hundred Twenty-Two Thousand Two Hundred Pesos (P30,222,200.00) appropriated shall be used exclusively for the implementation of Sustainable Development for Agrarian Reform Beneficiaries in the Bangsamoro (SDAReBB) Program, subject to the submission of Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and quarterly status report of implementation to MFBM, of which Ten Million Four Hundred Eighty-Two Thousand Two Hundred Fifty Pesos (P10,482,250.00) shall be used for the implementation of the MAFARDUCERS Program, subject further to the submission of list of validated beneficiaries.

Provision of Legal Support to Farmers and Fisherfolk:
The amount of Eight Million Seven Hundred Thirty-Eight Thousand Three Hundred Seventy-Three Pesos (P8,738,373.00) appropriated shall be used exclusively for the implementation of the Provision of Legal Support to Farmers and Fisherfolk Program, subject to the submission of Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and quarterly status report of implementation to MFBM.

Machinery, Equipment, and Infrastructure Facilities:
Upon completion of the construction of facilities and procurement of machineries and equipment, MAFAR shall turn over the management thereof to the farmers or fisherfolk organizations concerned, which shall commit to shoulder maintenance and repair costs.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
The implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on its financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
(a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
(b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
(c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when said reports have been submitted or posted on its website to the MFBM and other offices where the submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Promotes sustainable agri-fishery growth, equitable land distribution, and tenurial security, ensuring food security through climate-resilient support services and agri-aqua enterprise development.
data.powers_and_functions:
Provide integrated services on production, utilization, conservation, and disposition of agricultural, livestock, and fishery resources.
Plan, formulate, execute, regulate, and monitor agriculture and food supply programs.
Promulgate and enforce laws and regulations on conserving and utilizing agricultural, livestock, and fishery resources.
Establish information systems that support production, marketing, and financing for farmers and investors.
Deliver extension services and training covering financing, production, and marketing of agricultural and fishery enterprises.
Conduct and disseminate research on technologies for agricultural crops, livestock, fisheries, and allied commodities.
Facilitate farmer, fisherfolk, and entrepreneur participation in policy and program formulation.
Coordinate with public and private agencies to support ministry policies and programs.
Regulate import and export of agricultural and fishery commodities within existing guidelines.
Approve charter contracts and issue fishing permits and licenses within BARMM waters.
Designate fish landing points and assist LGUs in managing municipal waters.
Regulate production, capture, and gathering of fish and aquatic products and designate fishery reserves.
Implement agrarian laws, issue legal orders, and enforce agrarian reform decisions.
Advise on executive orders and legislation to strengthen agrarian reform and protect beneficiaries.
Establish policies, rules, and priorities for agrarian reform implementation in BARMM.
Coordinate agrarian reform programs with Land Bank of the Philippines and relevant agencies.
Acquire, administer, distribute, and develop agricultural lands for agrarian purposes.
Conduct land surveys and issue Certificates of Land Ownership Awards and emancipation patents.
Provide legal services to beneficiaries and resolve agrarian conflicts.
Promote cooperatives and organizations of agrarian reform beneficiaries and deliver continuing education.
Approve land-use conversion requests and mobilize support from governmental and non-governmental organizations.

data.name: Ministry of Basic, Higher, and Technical Education
data.description: Formulates, plans, implements, and coordinates policies and programs for formal and non-formal education at all levels, ensuring an integrated system of education responsive to Bangsamoro needs.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Quick Response Fund:
Two Hundred Million Pesos (P200,000,000.00) appropriated for the Quick Response Fund shall serve as a stand-by fund for replacement, reconstruction, rehabilitation, or repair of school buildings and facilities to normalize learning conditions after disasters. Fund release requires assessment reports, rehabilitation designs, and supporting documents. QRF shall not be used for pre-disaster activities such as training, insurance, or public information initiatives.

Provision of Learning Resources:
One Billion Five Hundred Sixty Million Nine Hundred Sixty-Three Thousand Three Hundred Pesos (P1,560,963,300.00) shall be released only upon submission of the list of learning resources procured using prior years' appropriations and the list of school beneficiaries. Purchases shall comply with applicable laws including R.A. Nos. 8047 and 9184.

Procurement of BARMM Signature Armchair:
Three Hundred Eighty-Four Million Seven Hundred Twenty Thousand Pesos (P384,720,000.00) under Support to Operations shall be used exclusively to procure BARMM Signature Armchairs with wide, laminated writing surfaces, subject to reporting on previous armchair procurements and learner beneficiaries.

Bangsamoro RESPECT Program:
One Hundred Thirty-One Million Five Hundred Thirty-Five Thousand Pesos (P131,535,000.00) shall be released only upon submission of the list of assigned personnel and the Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Systems Development:
Two Million Pesos (P2,000,000.00) shall be used exclusively to develop the Annual School-Based Assessment Report System.

School-Based Feeding Program:
Seven Hundred Fifty-Six Million Two Hundred Fifty Thousand Pesos (P756,250,000.00) shall feed 110,000 learners within 220 days, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, SBFP reports, and an administrative cost cap of 3.5%.

Home Grown School Feeding:
Twenty-Two Million Pesos (P22,000,000.00) shall feed 10,000 learners within 100 days, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and Home Grown School Feeding reports.

Inclusive Education:
Sixty-Nine Million Two Hundred Four Thousand One Hundred Sixty Pesos (P69,204,160.00) shall support Alternative Learning System, Abot Kaalaman sa Pamilyang Bangsamoro, Indigenous Peoples Education, and Special Education, subject to quarterly implementation reports to MFBM.

School Sports Program:
Fifty-Six Million Thirty-Eight Thousand Four Hundred Fifty Pesos (P56,038,450.00) shall fund the School Sports Program, with Ten Million Pesos (P10,000,000.00) earmarked for athlete training.

School-Building Program:
One Hundred Sixty-Two Million Twenty-Six Thousand Pesos (P162,026,000.00) shall be used for school construction, subject to submission of identified school beneficiaries and common engineering documents.

Infrastructure Integrity of School Buildings:
One Hundred Fifty-Eight Million Four Hundred Thousand Pesos (P158,400,000.00) shall rehabilitate, renovate, repair, and improve school buildings, subject to identified beneficiaries and engineering documents.

Teachers' Furniture and Fixtures:
Thirty-Nine Million Three Hundred Seventy-Five Thousand Pesos (P39,375,000.00) shall procure school desks, furniture, and fixtures for teachers, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Cash Allowance to Teachers:
Cash allowance funds shall provide Ten Thousand Pesos (P10,000.00) per classroom teacher annually for teaching supplies, connectivity expenses, and medical examination, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

World Teachers' Day Incentive Benefit:
One Thousand Pesos (P1,000.00) per teacher shall be granted during the World Teachers' Day celebration, subject to MBHTE-issued guidelines.

Appropriations for In-Service Training:
Three Hundred Sixty-Two Million Seventy Thousand Pesos (P362,070,000.00) shall fund in-service training and learning interventions for teachers and education personnel, integrating Values Transformation Training.

Access to Higher and Modern Education Scholarship Program:
Two Hundred Sixty-Four Million Three Hundred Thousand Pesos (P264,300,000.00) shall be released only upon submission of Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and quarterly implementation reports. MBHTE shall develop a scholar monitoring database.

Bangsamoro Kulliyyah for Islamic Studies:
Forty-Four Million Six Hundred Fifty-Eight Thousand Seven Hundred Pesos (P44,658,700.00) shall be used exclusively for land acquisition and construction of an administrative building.

TVET Scholarship:
Four Hundred Thirty-One Million Five Hundred Forty-Nine Thousand Six Hundred Ninety-Two Pesos (P431,549,692.00) shall be subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and quarterly status reports to MFBM.

Employability of BSPTVET Graduates:
One Million Eight Hundred Thousand Pesos (P1,800,000.00) shall fund a study on the employability of BSPTVET graduates.

Construction of Public Madrasah:
Four Hundred Eighteen Million Five Hundred Seventy Thousand Pesos (P418,570,000.00) shall fund land acquisition and construction of public madrasah, subject to identified beneficiaries and engineering documents.

Maintenance and Other Operating Expenses Allocation for Schools:
The MBHTE shall allocate school MOOE in accordance with ministry-issued guidelines and submit quarterly status reports to the MFBM.

Personnel Services Release Condition:
Personnel Services amounting to Five Billion Two Hundred Ninety-Six Million Five Hundred Eight Thousand Four Hundred Twenty-Six Pesos (P5,296,508,426.00) shall be released only when positions are filled and upon submission of appointment and deployment orders.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Formulates, plans, implements, and coordinates policies and programs for formal and non-formal education at all levels, ensuring an integrated system of education responsive to Bangsamoro needs.
data.powers_and_functions:
Develop and coordinate policies and programs covering basic, secondary, higher, technical, Madaris, non-formal, and indigenous education.
Establish and maintain an integrated system of quality education aligned with the national framework.
Create educational frameworks and curricula that reflect Bangsamoro ideals and institutionalize peace education.
Supervise and regulate public and private educational institutions, including Madaris.
Ensure integration of Islamic and Arabic studies in public elementary and high school curricula.
Develop curricula, textbooks, and teaching materials and maintain comprehensive physical education programs.
Establish training linkages for teaching and non-teaching personnel and manage recruitment, appointment, and promotion.
Determine organizational structures for divisions, districts, and schools and promulgate administrative guidelines.
Evaluate school division leadership and perform additional functions provided by law.

data.name: Ministry of Environment, Natural Resources and Energy
data.description: Oversees exploration, utilization, management, conservation, protection, and sustainable development of the region’s environment, natural resources, and energy sources.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Renovation of Kalikasan Building:
Four Million Three Hundred Thirty-Four Thousand Nine Hundred Seventy-Nine Pesos (P4,334,979.00) shall fund the construction of a two-storey supply and property office and storage room, subject to submission of common engineering documents.

Bangsamoro Sustainable and Development Board:
One Million Five Hundred Thousand Pesos (P1,500,000.00) shall support activities of the Bangsamoro Sustainable and Development Board.

Energy Management and Regulation:
One Million One Hundred Sixty-Eight Thousand Pesos (P1,168,000.00) shall be used exclusively for drafting the Bangsamoro Energy Code.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly financial and physical accomplishment reports within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Oversees exploration, utilization, management, conservation, protection, and sustainable development of the region’s environment, natural resources, and energy sources.
data.powers_and_functions:
Recommend regional legislation on natural resources, energy development, and pollution control.
Formulate and implement policies and programs for managing environment, natural resources, and energy.
Promulgate rules regulating exploration, development, conservation, and commercial activities affecting resources.
Exercise supervision over forest lands, agricultural lands, mineral resources, and national parks.
Recommend protected area declarations and conduct resource assessments.
Coordinate with private sector on resource utilization, perform geological surveys, and implement conservation programs.
Issue regulations on land classification, forest resource use, and mineral exploration.
Administer public lands, control pollution, and oversee energy industry restructuring.
Supervise energy projects, conserve biodiversity, and develop multi-sectoral conservation strategies.

data.name: Ministry of Finance, and Budget and Management
data.description: Evolves sound, efficient, and responsive fiscal management for the Bangsamoro Government by formulating, institutionalizing, and administering fiscal policies and resource utilization.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Support to Shari'ah Supervisory Board:
The amount of Six Million Three Hundred Ninety Thousand One Hundred Sixteen Pesos (P6,390,116.00) appropriated for Support to Islamic Finance Bodies and Institutions shall allocate Three Million Five Hundred Seventy-One Thousand Seven Hundred Four Pesos (P3,571,704.00) exclusively for professional services of the Shari'ah Supervisory Board.

Digitalization of Financial Management Systems:
The Ministry shall endeavor to digitalize manual systems of financial management. For this purpose, Nine Million Six Hundred Fifty-Three Thousand Pesos (P9,653,000.00) under the Regional and Local Expenditure Management Strengthening Program shall be used exclusively for the deployment of the electronic National Government Accounting System (e-NGAS) to local government units and other offices in BARMM, of which Eight Million Six Hundred Forty-Five Thousand Pesos (P8,645,000.00) shall be used to procure IT equipment for the said purpose.

Improvement of Physical Plant:
The Ministry shall initiate activities for the planning and forecasting of the architectural and engineering requirements for the establishment of the Ministry's Operational Center, charged to the available Contingent Fund and subject to the submission of a Detailed Work and Financial Plan.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after each quarter, or earlier as may be required, through:
  a. Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  b. Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Evolves sound, efficient, and responsive fiscal management for the Bangsamoro Government by formulating, institutionalizing, and administering fiscal policies and resource utilization.
data.powers_and_functions:
Formulate medium-term expenditure frameworks and annual resource mobilization plans.
Prepare the Bangsamoro Government’s annual budget and manage fiscal and tax policy.
Supervise revenue collection, manage financial resources, and administer public debt.
Coordinate policies of financial institutions and government-owned corporations.
Implement local revenue administration policies and coordinate on fiscal and monetary matters.
Maintain standard accounting systems, study bureaucracy performance, and manage compensation and position classification.
Streamline government systems and perform additional functions assigned by the Minister.

data.name: Ministry of Health
data.description: Formulates, plans, implements, and coordinates health policies and programs to promote, protect, preserve, and restore the health of the Bangsamoro people.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Purchase and Allocation of Drugs, Medicines and Vaccines:
Ninety-One Million Four Hundred One Thousand Five Hundred Sixty-Two Pesos (P91,401,562.00) shall procure drugs and medicines for the Immunization Program, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, detailed procurement plan, allocation per area, and quarterly distribution reports to MFBM.

Advance Payment for Drugs and Vaccines Not Locally Available:
MOH is authorized to deposit or pay in advance for the procurement of drugs and vaccines not locally available from WHO, UNICEF, and other specialized agencies or financing institutions when local suppliers cannot meet quantity requirements.

Procurement of Capital Outlays, and Supplies and Medicines:
Funds appropriated for capital outlays and supplies and medicines intended for Integrated Provincial Health Offices (IPHOs) and Rural Health Units shall be downloaded directly to the IPHOs, procured in accordance with existing laws, and distributed to RHUs.

Newborn Care Program:
Twenty-Four Million Seven Hundred Thirty-Nine Thousand Two Hundred Fifty Pesos (P24,739,250.00) shall support newborn screening equipment, routine care kits, congenital anomaly medicines, and expanded screening kits, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, distribution list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

MOH Medical Scholarship Program:
Eighty-Three Million Four Hundred Ninety-Nine Thousand Pesos (P83,499,000.00) shall fund medical scholarships, subject to submission of scholar lists, Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, and quarterly status report to MFBM. MOH shall maintain a scholars monitoring database.

Complementary Feeding Program:
Six Million Pesos (P6,000,000.00) shall fund dietary supplementation for pregnant women and children aged 0-24 months, with administrative and monitoring expenses capped at 1.5%. MOH shall coordinate with relevant ministries to incorporate fresh milk and enriched foods.

Barangay Health Workers:
Four Hundred Twelve Million Eight Hundred Thousand Pesos (P412,800,000.00) shall provide financial assistance to 8,600 Barangay Health Workers, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, beneficiary list, quarterly status report to MFBM, and timely distribution.

BHW Kits:
Twenty-One Million Five Hundred Thousand Pesos (P21,500,000.00) shall procure 8,600 kits for Barangay Health Workers.

Consultancy Services for Mental Health Program:
Three Million Pesos (P3,000,000.00) shall fund consulting services for the mental health program.

Medical Equipment:
Ninety Million Nine Hundred Sixty-Nine Thousand Three Hundred Thirty-Four Pesos (P90,969,334.00) shall be used exclusively to purchase medical equipment for MOH-supervised hospitals.

Hospital and Other Health Care Facilities Income:
Income generated by provincial, district, and municipal hospitals and other facilities shall be deposited in authorized government banks, with 20% remitted to the Bangsamoro Treasury Office and 80% retained to augment MOOE and capital outlays, subject to specified utilization conditions and reporting requirements.

Other Health Services:
Six Hundred One Million Eight Hundred Forty-Nine Thousand One Hundred Eighty-Six Pesos (P601,849,186.00) shall augment the Bangsamoro HRH Program and support designated offices and facilities, with priority for geographically isolated and disadvantaged areas and submission of deployment reports to MFBM.

Access to Promotive Health Care Service:
MOH shall submit quarterly status reports to MFBM covering all programs under Access to Promotive Health Care Service.

Medical Outreach Program:
Two Hundred Twenty Million Pesos (P220,000,000.00) shall fund medical outreach through the regular budget, covering drugs, medicines, goods, and related services after PhilHealth and other assistance deductions. Professional fees shall not exceed 50% of the approved assistance amount.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly financial and physical accomplishment reports within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Formulates, plans, implements, and coordinates health policies and programs to promote, protect, preserve, and restore the health of the Bangsamoro people.
data.powers_and_functions:
Define health policy, develop the Bangsamoro health plan, and advise on health implications of government measures.
Provide health programs, services, facilities, and coordinate with communities and partners.
Administer health laws, collect and disseminate health data, and propagate health information.
Conduct health research and training, regulate health facilities, and issue implementation orders.
Develop policies consistent with Islamic teachings and supervise provincial health offices.

data.name: Ministry of Human Settlements and Development
data.description: Acts as the primary agency for managing housing, human settlements, and urban development, crafting strategies that deliver adequate and affordable housing in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly financial and physical accomplishment reports within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Acts as the primary agency for managing housing, human settlements, and urban development, crafting strategies that deliver adequate and affordable housing in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.powers_and_functions:
Develop integrated housing and settlement plans with LGUs and stakeholders.
Coordinate development undertakings, manage proclaimed housing sites, and enter into development agreements.
Receive and manage assets for housing, implement single regulatory systems, and conduct housing research.
Promote resilient, inclusive, and climate-adaptive housing policies and collect regulatory fees.
Recommend legislation, promote indigenous materials, regulate subdivision roads, and monitor LGU performance.
Develop people’s plans with beneficiaries, establish housing one-stop centers, secure land for housing, and perform other necessary functions.

data.name: Ministry of Indigenous Peoples' Affairs
data.description: Protects, promotes, and preserves the interests and well-being of indigenous peoples, recognizing their ancestral domains and rights within the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Comprehensive Survey on IP Household:
Two Million Seven Hundred Thousand Pesos (P2,700,000.00) appropriated for Survey, Research, Exploration and Development Expenses shall be used exclusively for the survey on IP households, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and quarterly status report of implementation to MFBM.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  a. Submission of hardcopy to MFBM;
  b. Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  c. Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Protects, promotes, and preserves the interests and well-being of indigenous peoples, recognizing their ancestral domains and rights within the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.powers_and_functions:
Serve as the primary ministry assisting indigenous peoples in the region.
Review conditions and policies affecting IPs and propose relevant legislation.
Issue Certificates of Ancestral Domain Title and register them pursuant to Bangsamoro laws.
Formulate, implement, and monitor policies and programs for IP development and protection.
Engage experts, negotiate funding, and coordinate development programs for IP advancement.
Convene assemblies of IPs, issue marital certificates consistent with customs, and perform other related functions.

data.name: Ministry of Interior and Local Government
data.description: Exercises general supervision over Bangsamoro local government units, ensuring public safety, disaster preparedness, local autonomy, decentralization, and community empowerment.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Tulong ng Gobyernong Nagmamalasakit (TuGoN):
Funds shall be used for the Local Government Peace and Order Capacity Empowerment Program, including P86,000,000.00 for TuGoN Housing Projects (subject to PIPG and quarterly MFBM reports) and P20,336,000.00 for financial, food relief, reformation, reconciliation, and livelihood assistance, plus P1,500,000.00 for capacity building of 50 beneficiaries, subject to validated beneficiary lists.

Quick Response Fund:
One Hundred Million Pesos (P100,000,000.00) appropriated for QRF shall fund immediate response and relief programs following calamities. Fund use requires assessment of affected communities and exclusion of pre-disaster activities.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly financial and physical accomplishment reports within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Exercises general supervision over Bangsamoro local government units, ensuring public safety, disaster preparedness, local autonomy, decentralization, and community empowerment.
data.powers_and_functions:
Advise the Chief Minister on supervision policies for local governments.
Issue rules implementing laws on local supervision and autonomy and monitor compliance.
Provide technical assistance for regional legislation affecting LGUs.
Strengthen administrative, technical, and fiscal capabilities of local offices.
Implement public order, safety, and disaster preparedness programs and formulate emergency plans.
Enforce disciplinary authority over elective officials and perform additional statutory duties.

data.name: Ministry of Labor and Employment
data.description: Serves as the primary entity for labor and employment policy, fostering gainful employment, protecting workers’ welfare, and maintaining industrial peace in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Wages and Productivity:
The amount of Four Hundred Twenty Thousand Pesos (P420,000.00) herein appropriated shall be used exclusively for payment of Honoraria for the Members of Bangsamoro Tripartite Wages and Productivity Board (BTWPB), subject to existing rules and regulations on the payment of Honoraria.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
The implementing M/D/As shall submit quarterly reports on its financial and physical accomplishments, within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter, through the following:
  a. Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  b. Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  c. Publication to M/D/A's website.

The implementing M/D/As shall send written notice when said reports have been submitted or posted on its website to the MFBM and other offices where the submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules and regulations. The date of notice to said M/O/As shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Serves as the primary entity for labor and employment policy, fostering gainful employment, protecting workers’ welfare, and maintaining industrial peace in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.powers_and_functions:
Enforce labor legislation and regulate employer-worker relations.
Develop policies on manpower development, training, and allocation.
Recommend legislation for Bangsamoro labor force advancement and protect workers seeking local or overseas employment.
Regulate alien employment, formulate wage guidelines, and promote decent working conditions.
Maintain harmonious labor relations, uphold organizing rights, and facilitate dispute resolution.

data.name: Ministry of Public Order and Safety
data.description: Responsible for public safety, coordinating peace-building, reconciliation, and unification initiatives across the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Rido Knowledge Management:
The amount of One Million Eight Hundred Eighty Thousand and Four Hundred Pesos (P1,880,400.00) appropriated under the Alternative Dispute Resolution Program shall be exclusively used for digital profiling to address and gather baseline data on conflicts and rido across the BARMM.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
The implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on its financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
(a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
(b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
(c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when said reports have been submitted or posted on its website to the MFBM and other offices where the submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Responsible for public safety, coordinating peace-building, reconciliation, and unification initiatives across the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.powers_and_functions:
Participate in the Regional Peace and Order Council and coordinate with security agencies.
Monitor peace and security conditions, maintain early warning systems, and implement programs on tolerance and countering violent extremism.
Lead initiatives on peace, reconciliation, rido settlement, and implement laws on public order and safety.

data.name: Ministry of Public Works
data.description: Functions as the engineering and construction arm of the Bangsamoro Government for planning, designing, constructing, rehabilitating, and maintaining regional infrastructure.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Engineering and Administrative Overhead (EAO) Expenses:
For infrastructure projects costing more than One Million Pesos (P1,000,000.00), MPW may deduct up to 3% (not exceeding 2% for releases to District Engineering Offices) to cover EAO expenses limited to administrative overhead, pre-construction activities, construction project management, testing and quality control, acquisition and repair of related equipment, and contingencies. EAO shall be capitalized as part of project cost; vehicle acquisition must be justified as more economical than rental.

Project Development and Engineering Services:
One Hundred Seventy Million Seven Hundred Eighty-Nine Thousand Three Hundred Thirteen Pesos (P170,789,313.00) appropriated for pre-engineering activities shall be supported by reports on completed works.

Road Network and Other Public Infrastructure Facilities Program:
In implementing infrastructure projects, MPW may cluster procurements, adopt hazard-resilient standards, provide bike lanes, ensure potable water facilities, and apply cost-effective bio-engineering solutions. Funding release requires submission of common engineering documents.

Geo-Tagging of Infrastructure Projects:
MPW shall publish geo-tagged photos with status updates for all projects on the E-BARMM portal and MPW website, and regularly submit status reports to MFBM, BPDA, and OCM.

Restriction on Delegation of Project Implementation:
MPW may delegate project implementation to AFP Corps of Engineers or equivalent agencies in high-risk areas, inter-agency projects, or capable LGUs, subject to MPW’s overall technical supervision.

Ensuring Accessibility for Senior Citizens and Persons with Disabilities:
All public building projects shall incorporate accessibility features consistent with Batas Pambansa Blg. 344, R.A. Nos. 7277 and 9994, their IRRs, and universal design principles.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly financial and physical accomplishment reports within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Functions as the engineering and construction arm of the Bangsamoro Government for planning, designing, constructing, rehabilitating, and maintaining regional infrastructure.
data.powers_and_functions:
Plan, design, construct, and supervise infrastructure within the region.
Maintain public works, manage necessary equipment, and seek national funding support.
Enforce construction standards, supervise public works quality, and provide technical assistance.
Coordinate with agencies and communities to ensure responsive infrastructure services.

data.name: Ministry of Science and Technology
data.description: Provides leadership in science, research, technological education, and innovation, ensuring broad participation in planning and implementing scientific initiatives in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Early Warning Stations:
Eight Million Eight Hundred Twenty-Five Thousand Pesos (P8,825,000.00) shall procure machineries and equipment for Bangsamoro Disaster Risk Reduction and Management.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly financial and physical accomplishment reports within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Provides leadership in science, research, technological education, and innovation, ensuring broad participation in planning and implementing scientific initiatives in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.powers_and_functions:
Formulate comprehensive science and technology plans and oversee implementation.
Pursue research and development addressing regional priorities and support technology commercialization.
Enhance services in IT and disaster risk reduction, manage science data, and administer scholarships and awards.
Improve science education infrastructure, conduct advanced research, and develop quality standards including halal testing.

data.name: Ministry of Social Services and Development
data.description: Provides balanced, responsive social welfare services that protect the rights and address the needs of marginalized and vulnerable sectors, especially in times of crisis.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Unlad Pamilyang Bangsamoro:
Four Hundred Fifty-Two Million Two Hundred Seventy-One Thousand Five Hundred Fifty-Six Pesos (P452,271,556.00) under the Family and Community Welfare Program shall be used exclusively for assistance to poor households, subject to the submission to MFBM of the Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated list of beneficiaries, and quarterly status report of implementation.

Layag Bajau:
Eighty-Three Million Two Hundred Thousand Pesos (P83,200,000.00) under the Family and Community Welfare Program shall be used exclusively for assistance to qualified Badjau households, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Angat Bangsamoro Kabataan Tungo sa Karunungan:
One Hundred Ten Million Pesos (P110,000,000.00) shall be used exclusively for educational assistance to children of disadvantaged families and other needy adults, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Dakila Bangsamoro:
Eighty-Four Million Seven Hundred Thousand Pesos (P84,700,000.00) shall be used exclusively for assistance to indigent solo parents, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Welfare Goods for Social Protection:
Twenty-Five Million Pesos (P25,000,000.00) under the Family and Community Welfare Program shall be used exclusively for procurement of welfare goods for social protection interventions, subject to quarterly status reporting to MFBM.

Bangsamoro Sagip Kabuhayan:
Fifteen Million Pesos (P15,000,000.00) shall be used exclusively to provide seed capital assistance to households, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Child Development Workers and SNP Workers Honorarium:
One Hundred Twenty-Four Million Three Hundred Twenty Thousand Pesos (P124,320,000.00) under the Child and Youth Welfare Program shall be used exclusively to augment honoraria for Child Development Workers and Supervised Neighborhood Play Workers, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Augmentation of Supplementary Feeding Program:
One Hundred Four Million Six Hundred Sixty-One Thousand Pesos (P104,661,000.00) under the Child and Youth Welfare Program shall exclusively augment the Supplementary Feeding Program for children in Child Development Centers and Supervised Neighborhood Plays, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Kupkop Program:
One Hundred Seven Million Four Hundred Thousand Pesos (P107,400,000.00) under the Child and Youth Welfare Program shall provide financial assistance for case-managed orphans, trafficked, disengaged children, and youth, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Operationalization of Bahay Pag-asa:
Twenty-Seven Million Five Hundred Forty-Eight Thousand Six Hundred Ten Pesos (P27,548,610.00) under the Child and Youth Welfare Program shall be used exclusively for the operation of Bahay Pag-asa facilities.

Livelihood Package to BABAE Association:
Eight Million Pesos (P8,000,000.00) under the Women's Welfare Program shall be used exclusively to provide livelihood packages for organized women's organizations, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Women's Opportunities to Maternal Benefits (WOMB):
Ten Million Pesos (P10,000,000.00) under the Women's Welfare Program shall be used exclusively to provide maternity kits supporting indigent pregnant women, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Bangsamoro Women's Studies for Institutional and Legislative Reforms and Advocacies (BASIRA):
Four Million Seven Hundred Ten Thousand Pesos (P4,710,000.00) under the Women's Welfare Program shall be used exclusively for Bangsamoro Women's Studies focusing on the lived experiences of Manobo women, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Hadiya Package:
Twenty-Two Million One Hundred Twenty-Five Thousand Pesos (P22,125,000.00) under the Older Persons and Persons with Disability Program shall provide care packages for senior citizens, including Sagip Paningin Para kay Lolo at Lola, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Assistive Devices:
Fifteen Million Two Hundred Sixty-Four Thousand Pesos (P15,264,000.00) of supplies and materials shall be used exclusively for assistive devices, equally split between older persons and persons with disabilities, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Kalinga Para sa may Kapansanan:
Two Hundred Seventy Million Pesos (P270,000,000.00) under the Older Persons and Persons with Disability Program shall be used exclusively for assistance to persons with disabilities, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated beneficiary list, and quarterly status report to MFBM.

Emergency Relief Assistance:
Three Hundred Thirty-Six Million Five Hundred Thousand Pesos (P336,500,000.00) under the Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency Assistance Program shall be used exclusively for procurement of welfare goods for emergency relief assistance to needy individuals and families, including IDPs, subject to quarterly status report to MFBM.

Emergency Shelter Assistance:
Sixty Million Pesos (P60,000,000.00) under the Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency Assistance Program shall be used exclusively for emergency shelter assistance, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Ligtas Pamilya Program:
Sixteen Million Five Hundred Fifty Thousand Pesos (P16,550,000.00) of supplies and materials under the Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency Assistance Program shall provide emergency go bags to highly vulnerable families, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Multi-Purpose Cash Assistance Program:
Twenty-Nine Million Pesos (P29,000,000.00) of financial assistance/subsidy under the Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency Assistance Program shall provide assistance for anticipatory action, response, and recovery to vulnerable families, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Lingkod Pamayanan Para sa Kapayapaan Program:
One Hundred Twenty-Five Million Nine Hundred Seventy-One Thousand Two Hundred Pesos (P125,971,200.00) of financial assistance/subsidy under the Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency Assistance Program shall provide financial subsidy to volunteers of community services programs for disaster risk reduction and protective services, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Water Sanitation and Hygiene Intervention:
Thirty Million Pesos (P30,000,000.00) of supplies and materials under the Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency Assistance Program shall be used exclusively to provide hygiene kits to vulnerable families, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines.

Bangsamoro CARES:
Four Hundred Fifty Million Pesos (P450,000,000.00) under the Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency Assistance Program shall be used exclusively for Critical Assistance in Response to Emergency Situation.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Provides balanced, responsive social welfare services that protect the rights and address the needs of marginalized and vulnerable sectors, especially in times of crisis.
data.powers_and_functions:
Formulate and implement social welfare plans and adopt effective program policies.
Support non-governmental welfare services, operate institutional facilities, and strengthen people’s organizations.
Coordinate service networks, accredit social welfare institutions, and conduct research.
Build local and international linkages, develop training programs, disseminate information, and deputize agencies for rights protection.
Regulate fund drives, set service standards, supervise social workers, coordinate disaster relief, and oversee programs for marginalized sectors.

data.name: Ministry of Trade, Investments, and Tourism
data.description: Implements laws and programs on trade, investments, and tourism to drive Bangsamoro industrialization, liberalization, and market expansion aligned with inclusive economic growth.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Propelling Economic and Sustainable Opportunities (PESO) for MSMEs:
Fifty Million Pesos (P50,000,000.00) shall be used exclusively to establish halal-compliant micro-financing services for MSMEs, subject to Program Implementation Plan and Guidelines, validated list of MSMEs availing the services, and quarterly status report of implementation to MFBM.

Implementation of Shared Service Facilities:
Four Million Eight Hundred Forty-Five Thousand Eight Hundred Twenty-Eight Pesos (P4,845,828.00) shall be used for projects that improve MSME productivity and quality, prioritizing industry clusters identified through stakeholder consultations. Upon procurement of equipment, management shall be turned over to cooperators who will shoulder maintenance and repair costs. After two years, MTIT may transfer ownership, extend usufruct, or reassign management based on performance.

Negosyo Centers:
Two Million Five Hundred Seventy-Three Thousand Seven Hundred Fifty Pesos (P2,573,750.00) shall be used exclusively for the management of Negosyo Centers.

Freeport Ecozone Service:
One Million Five Hundred Thousand Pesos (P1,500,000.00) shall be used exclusively for the construction of a Material Recovery Facility.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly financial and physical accomplishment reports within thirty (30) days after each quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Implements laws and programs on trade, investments, and tourism to drive Bangsamoro industrialization, liberalization, and market expansion aligned with inclusive economic growth.
data.powers_and_functions:
Formulate development policies and coordinate enforcement with relevant agencies.
Maintain investment-friendly environments, promote local and foreign investment, and manage marketing initiatives.
Set standards for tourism establishments, regulate operations, and protect tourists.
Coordinate infrastructure and social support for tourist zones and lead halal industry development.
Support MSMEs, local economic development, and establish business support centers.
Administer adjudication on trade, investment, tourism, and cooperative laws.

data.name: Ministry of Transportation and Communications
data.description: Leads policy, planning, regulation, and administration of transportation and communications networks, delivering fast, safe, efficient, and reliable services in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
Implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
  (a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
  (b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
  (c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when the reports have been submitted or posted on their website to the MFBM and other offices where submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Leads policy, planning, regulation, and administration of transportation and communications networks, delivering fast, safe, efficient, and reliable services in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.powers_and_functions:
Administer transportation and communications laws and deputize enforcement agencies.
Formulate policies, grant franchises, register transport and telecommunications operators, and exercise quasi-judicial functions.
Manage inland navigation, landside port and airport operations, and regulate telecommunications utilities.
Monitor postal services, generate revenues from transport operations, and impose duties and fees.
Ensure free movement across zones of joint cooperation and execute additional devolved functions.

data.name: Office of the Wali
data.description: Serves as the ceremonial head of the Bangsamoro Government, preserving Bangsamoro culture, well-being, and unity through public and ceremonial representation.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Per Diem of the Wali:
The amount of Two Hundred Three Thousand Two Hundred Pesos (P203,200.00) per month or an annual amount of Two Million Four Hundred Thirty-Eight Thousand Four Hundred Pesos (P2,438,400.00) appropriated shall be used as the per diem of the Wali pursuant to Section 5 Article VIII of R.A. No. 11054.

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
The implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on its financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
(a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
(b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
(c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when said reports have been submitted or posted on its website to the MFBM and other offices where the submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Serves as the ceremonial head of the Bangsamoro Government, preserving Bangsamoro culture, well-being, and unity through public and ceremonial representation.

data.name: Bangsamoro Human Rights Commission
data.description: Protects and promotes human rights in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, ensuring adherence to international standards and providing transitional justice mechanisms.
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
The implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on its financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
(a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
(b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
(c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when said reports have been submitted or posted on its website to the MFBM and other offices where the submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.
data.mandate: Protects and promotes human rights in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, ensuring adherence to international standards and providing transitional justice mechanisms.

data.name: Bangsamoro Ports Management Authority
data.description: Manages and oversees public port operations within the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, aligning port facilities with the national maritime transport chain.
data.mandate: Manages and oversees public port operations within the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, aligning port facilities with the national maritime transport chain.

data.name: Bangsamoro Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council
data.description: Coordinates, integrates, supervises, and evaluates disaster risk reduction and management activities, ensuring disaster-sensitive regional development plans and coordinated emergency response.
data.mandate: Coordinates, integrates, supervises, and evaluates disaster risk reduction and management activities, ensuring disaster-sensitive regional development plans and coordinated emergency response.

data.name: Bangsamoro Economic and Development Council
data.description: Acts as the socio-economic planning, monitoring, and coordinating agency for development plans, programs, and projects of the Bangsamoro Government.
data.mandate: Acts as the socio-economic planning, monitoring, and coordinating agency for development plans, programs, and projects of the Bangsamoro Government.

data.name: Bangsamoro Regional Peace and Order Council
data.description: Formulates peace and order measures, monitors implementation, and addresses complaints to enhance public safety throughout the Bangsamoro region.
data.mandate: Formulates peace and order measures, monitors implementation, and addresses complaints to enhance public safety throughout the Bangsamoro region.

data.name: Bangsamoro Sustainable Development Board
data.description: Promotes sustainable development by integrating environmental, social, and economic considerations into regional policies and projects.
data.mandate: Promotes sustainable development by integrating environmental, social, and economic considerations into regional policies and projects.

data.name: Bangsamoro Halal Board
data.description: Provides policy direction for the Halal industry, ensuring standards compliance and promoting Halal-certified products in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.mandate: Provides policy direction for the Halal industry, ensuring standards compliance and promoting Halal-certified products in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.

data.name: Bangsamoro Education Board
data.description: Formulates education policies and standards to deliver quality education that responds to the needs of the Bangsamoro people.
data.mandate: Formulates education policies and standards to deliver quality education that responds to the needs of the Bangsamoro people.

data.name: Bangsamoro Economic Zone Authority
data.description: Encourages and accelerates industrial, economic, and social development through the establishment of special economic zones and free ports, attracting investments and job creation.
data.mandate: Encourages and accelerates industrial, economic, and social development through the establishment of special economic zones and free ports, attracting investments and job creation.

data.name: Bangsamoro Maritime Industry Authority
data.description: Regulates maritime activities, issues licenses, registers vessels, and ensures maritime safety and compliance within the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.
data.mandate: Regulates maritime activities, issues licenses, registers vessels, and ensures maritime safety and compliance within the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region.

data.name: Civil Aeronautics Board of the Bangsamoro
data.description: Regulates air carriers and related services in the region, issuing certificates of public convenience and ensuring passenger safety and rights.
data.mandate: Regulates air carriers and related services in the region, issuing certificates of public convenience and ensuring passenger safety and rights.

data.name: Civil Aviation Authority of the Bangsamoro
data.description: Manages, supervises, and controls government airports in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, maintaining safe and secure civil aviation operations.
data.mandate: Manages, supervises, and controls government airports in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, maintaining safe and secure civil aviation operations.

data.name: Bangsamoro Attorney-General's Office
data.notes:
Special Provisions:

Reporting and Posting Requirements:
The implementing M/O/As shall submit quarterly reports on its financial and physical accomplishments within thirty (30) days after the end of every quarter through:
(a) Submission of hardcopy to the MFBM;
(b) Submission of reports through electronic means; and
(c) Publication to M/O/A's website.

The implementing M/O/As shall send written notice when said reports have been submitted or posted on its website to the MFBM and other offices where the submission of reports is required under existing laws, rules, and regulations. The date of such notice shall be considered the date of compliance with this requirement.

data.name: Office for Other Bangsamoro Communities
data.description: The Office for Other Bangsamoro Communities serves Bangsamoro people residing outside the BARMM territorial jurisdiction
data.mandate: Recommends policies and systematic programs for promoting the welfare of Bangsamoro communities outside the region, including provision of services.
data.powers_and_functions:
Gather socio-economic data and assess needs of Bangsamoro communities outside BARMM to inform responsive interventions.
Coordinate with BARMM ministries, offices, and agencies to integrate Other Bangsamoro Communities priorities into policies, programs, and services.
Facilitate partnerships with NGAs, LGUs, and development partners to protect OBC rights and advance socio-economic and cultural development.
